docs.lead_paragraph: Readers respond to Frank Rich's July 23 column, "The Passion of the Embryos"

headline.main: Administration Plays Chicken With Stem Cells

docs.abstract: Readers respond to Frank Rich's July 23 column, "The Passion of the Embryos" Ellen Cimino, Norcross, Ga.: I don't know if you have heard about the crossover vote in Georgia last week, but all of the Democrats and independents I talked to had voted Republican last week against Ralph Reed. This is the second time [...]
docs.snippet: Readers respond to Frank Rich's July 23 column, "The Passion of the Embryos" Ellen Cimino, Norcross, Ga.: I don't know if you have heard about the crossover vote in Georgia last week, but all of the Democrats and independents I talked to had voted...

docs.lead_paragraph: The anti-abortion bill that makes it a federal crime to help an under-age girl cross state lines takes a politically popular concept and applies it to a range of cases that could include particularly desperate young women.
docs.snippet: The anti-abortion bill that makes it a federal crime to help an under-age girl cross state lines takes a politically popular concept and applies it to a range of cases that could include particularly desperate young women.

docs.lead_paragraph: The bill would make it a crime to help an under-age girl escape parental notification laws by crossing state lines.

headline.main: Senate Removes Abortion Option for Young Girls
headline.print_headline: Senate Restricts Abortion Option For Young Girls

docs.snippet: The bill would make it a crime to help an under-age girl escape parental notification laws by crossing state lines.

docs.lead_paragraph: “There are two very different views of freedom in America today, arising from two very different moral and political worldviews dividing the country.”
docs.snippet: “There are two very different views of freedom in America today, arising from two very different moral and political worldviews dividing the country.”

docs.lead_paragraph: If one were to draw an EKG of the career of Keith Carradine, who returns to Broadway after an absence of 15 years, the ups and downs would be as sharp as the beating of an erratic heart.

headline.seo: Keith Carradine - Dirty Rotten Scoundrels - Theater
headline.main: Keith Carradine’s Long Road to ‘Dirty Rotten Scoundrels’
headline.print_headline: An Opportune Time To Get in Touch With His Inner Scoundrel

docs.snippet: If one were to draw an EKG of the career of Keith Carradine, who returns to Broadway after an absence of 15 years, the ups and downs would be as sharp as the beating of an erratic heart.

docs.lead_paragraph: The coming-of-age drama “Quinceañera,” a suprise hit at the Sundance Film Festival, was filmed almost entirely in a working-class Latino neighborhood of Los Angeles.

headline.main: Not Fat, Not Greek, Not a Wedding, but What a Party
headline.print_headline: Not Fat, Not Greek, Not a Wedding, but What a Party

docs.snippet: The coming-of-age drama “Quinceañera,” a suprise hit at the Sundance Film Festival, was filmed almost entirely in a working-class Latino neighborhood of Los Angeles.
